cyclone.name: DANNY
cyclone.current_location: about 110 miles ESE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest, expected to make landfall along the central South Carolina coast this evening and then weaken while tracking inland across southern South Carolina and central-eastern Georgia
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central South Carolina coast between Edisto Beach and South Santee River

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (for Tropical Storm conditions)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Edisto Beach SC to South Santee River SC (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: central and southern South Carolina coast and the Georgia coast, including areas near Brunswick
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds 20–30 mph possible Monday night into early Tuesday; brief tropical-storm-force gusts cannot be ruled out.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge inundation expected along the Georgia coast; values well below 3 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: 1–3 inches of rainfall possible with locally higher amounts causing brief, localized urban or poor-drainage flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Thunderstorms with frequent lightning; brief reduced visibilities in heavy showers may disrupt vessel movements and cargo handling.
